page.title: 19 EVENTS
page.content: Binfield Heath Congregational Chapel was built in eighteen thirty five, and constructed in a Gothic style. It has a narrow battlemented watch tower which forms part of the entrance and doorway. The Chapel was formerly run by the Rev.James Sherman. Binfield Heath has its own baby sitting club and annually holds a district flower show, which is held in late July or early August and has run since nineteen forty eight. The village also has its own playground which is intended mainly for younger children and has swings, a merry-go-round, a slide, a rocking horse and a sand pit. The playground is run for the parish council by a local committee. All the equipment was brought with money raised locally
